intro: Ricotia tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ricotia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
